newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli shekel rises against dollar, basket.
newsitem.headline: Israeli shekel rises against dollar, basket.

text.p: The Israeli shekel strengthened on Wednesday against the dollar and the basket of foreign currencies in thin trading, dealers said.
"Trading was extremely quiet today and activity was minimal. The shekel traded in tight ranges closing slightly higher against the dollar," said a dealer at Israel Discount Bank.
"The shekel gained against the basket following the decline of the yen and the mark in markets abroad," he added.

The representative rate for the dollar was fixed at 3.2340 shekels against 3.2380 on Tuesday. The basket, composed of the dollar, mark, pound sterling, French franc and yen, closed at 3.6415 shekels against 3.6526 on Tuesday.
On the crosses the shekel traded against the yen at 2.9034 shekels per 100 yen against 2.9124 on Tuesday and against the mark at 2.1473 shekels against 2.1647 on Tuesday.
In late afternoon the dollar was trading at 3.2350 shekels.
